covered: Valid Deletion: Scenarios cover successful deletion with default and with optional parameters.
Non-Existent Resource: Tests cover idempotent 204 for non-existent accounts.
Soft Deletes: Tests verify accounts are marked as closed (soft delete behavior).
Query Parameters: Comprehensive coverage of boolean flags and extra/unsupported parameters.
Authorization: Tests cover missing X-Killbill-CreatedBy header (400) and missing/invalid authentication (401).
Error Handling: System error (500) scenario and invalid accountId (400) scenario are tested.
Validation: Input validation for accountId format and basic injection/xss cases.
Timeout/Retry: Tests for transient network failure and retry behavior.
Performance/Concurrency: Large-scale and concurrent scenarios tested (TC18), including idempotence.
Regression: Tests for unpaid invoices handling and backward compatibility.
gaps: Rate Limiting: No tests verifying rate limiting or throttling.
Caching Behavior: No tests for caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) or cache validation.
Pagination: Not applicable to DELETE in this story, but no tests for bulk/list pagination in related endpoints.
Authorization Granularity: No tests covering 403 Forbidden for authenticated users without permissions.
Concurrency Edge Cases: No explicit race-condition tests (two clients deleting same account concurrently).
recommendations: Add rate-limiting/throttling tests for DELETE /accounts to ensure proper handling under load.
Introduce tests for 403 Forbidden when an authenticated user lacks permission to close accounts.
Add caching-related tests to verify ETag/Cache-Control behavior on the API responses.
Add explicit race-condition tests to validate correctness under concurrent deletions.
Clarify soft-delete semantics in tests if necessary (e.g., can be permanently deleted later).
Consider adding tests for 429 Too Many Requests when hitting limit and for 503 during dependent service outages.
